titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Communist Party of the United States of America Poster Collection GRAPHICS.024
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Maggie Schreiner

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-02-19T17:41-0500

did.unittitle: Communist Party of the United States of America Poster Collection

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

physdesc.extent: in 13 flat file folders, 1 oversize box, and 10 oversize folders in a shared box.

did.abstract: The Communist Party of the United States of America (CPUSA) was founded in 1919 by members of the left wing of the Socialist Party USA. This collection consists of over three hundred posters dating from the 1930s to the present. The posters were created by the CPUSA, international Communist parties and others individuals and organizations. The posters represent a diverse array of topics of interest to the international Communist movement, including domestic and international political issues, Communist history, labor organizing, and solidarity movements. The collection places the CPUSA within the context of worldwide Communist organizing, and is particularly strong on international political issues.
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English, with a substantial number of items in French, German, Portuegese, Spanish, Romanian and Russian. There are additional materials in Amharic, Arabic, Chinese, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Japanese, Korean, and Swedish.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Communist Party of the United States of America.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Communist Party of the United States of America Poster Collection; GRAPHICS 024; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by the Communist Party USA are held by the Communist Party USA. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which the organization holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting the Communist Party USA.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Communist Party of the United States of America (CPUSA) was founded in 1919 by members of the left wing of the Socialist Party USA. The CPUSA played an important role in the labor movement, particularly in building the Congress of Industrial Organizations in the 1930s-1940s, and in struggles for civil rights for African Americans. The Party's cultural initiatives in the 1930s attracted a number of prominent artists and intellectuals, and its struggles to attain and maintain its legality were an important chapter in the history of U.S. civil liberties. Though the importance of the CPUSA declined after the 1950s, the Party remained active in the areas of anti-imperialism, civil rights, labor, peace, and women's rights.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: No original order was apparent when the posters were received from the donor. Posters were rehoused in appropriately sized archival oversize folders, boxes and flat-file drawers. The physical arrangement of the posters reflects the size and subject matter of the posters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by topic or region, with sub-topics when appropriate. Folder level description includes a scope and contents note describing related topics, people, places and other references. This information is derived from the images and text from the posters in each folder. Date ranges are approximate, and are based on information from the posters in each folder.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The majority of this collection was separated from The Daily Worker and The Daily World Photographs Collection (PHOTOS 223), which was donated to the Tamiment Library by the Communist Party of the USA and the Library of the Reference Center for Marxist Studies in the summer of 2006.
The following accession numbers are associated with this collection: 2011.117, 2014.177, NPA.2006.037, NPA.2006.047, NPA.2006.050, NPA.2006.078, NPA.2006.088, and NPA.2009.009.

See also the article by Michael Nash, Director of the Tamiment Library, Communist History at the Tamiment Library in American Communist History, Vol. 3, No. 2, 2004, for additional information on the library's holdings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of over three hundred posters dating from the 1930s to the present. The bulk of the collection dates from the 1970s to the present. The majority of posters do not have date information, and dates must be estimated from the content. The collection includes a diverse array of topics of interest to the international Communist movement, including domestic and international political issues, Communist history, labor organizing, and solidarity movements. There are a significant number of posters produced by the CPUSA, the Communist Party of Portugal, the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, the French Communist Party and the General Confederation of Labour (CGT), as well as posters created by a diverse range of organizations and individuals. There are a significant number of posters produced for the annual World Youth and Students Festival. The posters in this collection include a diverse array of graphic styles and production techniques. The collection places the CPUSA within the context of worldwide Communist organizing, and is particularly strong on international political issues.
